revised_title: A Study of Two Egyptian Ibis Mummies and the Embalming Techniques Used
tldr: The author examines two mummies of the Egyptian Ibis, one in a remarkably perfect state, and discusses the embalming techniques used to preserve them. The mummies were found in earthen jars and wrapped in cloth, with the larger mummy exhibiting a well-preserved bird covered in a resinous substance. The author also compares the different methods of embalming observed in these mummies and discusses the historical context of animal mummies in ancient Egypt.
